note.para:
case study SANS of AF1410 steel
The data file contains multiple SASentry elements that pertain to different samples treated at different conditions in a time series. Each SASentry element contains two SASdata sections that correspond to sector averages from the two-dimensional SANS data. Since the samples had been subjected to a 1.6T magentic field to clear the scattering from magentic domain boundaries in one direction, the sector average for that direction has scattering dominated by purely nuclear scattering moments. The other SASdata section has scattering due to both nuclear and magnetic scattering moments.
Also see the publication: A.J. Allen, D. Gavillet, J.R. Weertman, "Small-Angle Neutron Scattering Studies of Carbide Precipitation in Ultrahigh-Strength Steels," Acta Metall 41 (1993) 1869-1884.
